elements.content: Crystallographic datacrystallographic data‡ Experimental data for 1: a mixture of Co(NO3)2·6H2O (145 mg, 0.5 mmol), 1,4-H2ndc (108 mg, 0.5 mmol), 1,3-bix (119 mg, 0.5 mmol), NaOH (10 mg, 0.25 mol), and water (12 mL) was placed in a 23 ml Teflon reactor and kept under autogenous pressure at 150 °C for three days. Then the mixture was cooled to room temperature, and pink crystals of 1 were obtained in a 46% yield based on Co(II). Elem. and ICP anal. for C76H57.5Ca0.2Co4N8O19: calcd (%): C 55.98, H 3.56, N 6.87, Ca 0.49. Found (%): C 55.72, H 3.46, N 6.79, Ca 0.44. ICP analyses for the 1,4-H2ndc and 1,3-bix gave the contents of Ca as 3.1‰ and 3.4‰, respectively.
elements.clean_text:
Crystallographic data

crystallographic data

‡ Experimental data for 1: a mixture of Co(NO3)2⋅6H2O (145 mg, 0.5 mmol), 1,4-H2ndc (108 mg, 0.5 mmol), 1,3-bix (119 mg, 0.5 mmol), NaOH (10 mg, 0.25 mol), and water (12 mL) was placed in a 23 ml Teflon reactor and kept under autogenous pressure at 150 °C for three days. Then the mixture was cooled to room temperature, and pink crystals of 1 were obtained in a 46% yield based on Co(II). Elem. and ICP anal. for C76H57.5Ca0.2Co4N8O19: calcd (%): C 55.98, H 3.56, N 6.87, Ca 0.49. Found (%): C 55.72, H 3.46, N 6.79, Ca 0.44. ICP analyses for the 1,4-H2ndc and 1,3-bix gave the contents of Ca as 3.1‰ and 3.4‰, respectively.

elements.content: Experimental datawaterIIHH§ Crystal data for 1 (C76H57.5Ca0.2Co4N8O19): monoclinic, space group P21/n, Mr = 1630.54, a = 15.414(5), b = 15.591(5), c = 16.260(5) Å, β = 117.953(5)°, V = 3451.7(19) Å3, Z = 2, μ = 8.221 mm−1, Dc = 1.569 mg m−3, F(000) = 1667, T = 293(2) K, 25910 reflections collected, 6161 unique with Rint = 0.0774, R1 = 0.0567, wR2 = 0.1641 (I > 2σ(I)) and GOF = 0.971. Single-crystal X-ray diffraction data for complex 1 was recorded at a temperature of 293(2) K on an Oxford Diffraction Gemini R Ultra diffractometer, using a ω scan technique with CuKα radiation (λ = 1.54184 Å). All the structures were solved by Direct Method of SHELXS-97 and refined by full-matrix least-squares techniques using the SHELXL-97 program. Non-hydrogen atoms were refined with anisotropic temperature parameters, and hydrogen atoms of the ligands were refined as rigid groups. The hydrogen atoms associated with the water molecules were not located from the difference Fourier maps. The Ca(II) atom was refined with an occupancy of 0.1, which was suggested by the ICP analysis. At this point, to balance the positive charge of Ca(II) atom, the occupancies for OH− and H2O in O9 should be 0.2 and 0.8, respectively. CCDC 783322.

The hydrogen atoms associated with the water molecules were not located from the difference Fourier maps. Single-crystal X-ray diffraction data for complex 1 was recorded at a temperature of 293(2) K on an Oxford Diffraction Gemini R Ultra diffractometer, using a ω scan technique with CuKα radiation (λ = 1.54184 Å).
